April 30, 1958
Mr, Marcus Cohn
Cohn & Marks
Cafritz Building
Washington 6, D. C,
Dear Marcus:
While I think there is little likelihood
of the Smathers proposal (S 2834) being adopted, if it
were to be approved in its present form, it would cause
great harm to the University of Illinois, as well as to
many other educational institutions. As an institution
of higher education and a land grant University, the
University of Illinois operates non-commercial, educational
AM and PM radio stations and a non-commercial, educational
television station. It also operates a University Press,
and might from time to time publish musical works. As an
educational endeavor, the University sells a limited
number of records.
Therefore, it would be of deep concern to
the University of Illinois to see the Smathers bill
adopted in its present form. In connection with your
representation of NAEB interests, I would be happy to
prepare any materials which would aid in securing a
desired change in language, and if necessary, I feel sure
a representative of the University could be made available
to testify.
Sincerely yours.
Prank E. Schooley
Director of Broadcasting
